1.text: In the third year to the kingdom of Belshazzar the king a vision was seen to me, I Daniel, after that being seen to me in the beginning.

2.text: And I shall see in a vision; and it will be in my seeing, and I in Shushan the fortress, in Elam the province; and I shall see in a vision, and I was by the stream of strength.

3.text: And I shall lift up mine eyes, and I shall see, and behold, one ram stood before the stream, and horns to him: and the horns high; and the one high above the second, and the high came up at the last.

4.text: And I saw the ram pushing the sea, and north and south; and all the beasts will not stand before him, and none delivering from his hand; and he did according to his will, and increased.

5.text: And I was considering, and behold, a he goat of the goats came from the west upon the face of all the earth, and not touching upon the earth: and the he goat a horn of vision between his eyes.

6.text: And ha will come even to the ram possessing the horns, which I saw standing before the stream, and he will run against him in the wrath of his power.

7.text: And I saw him coming near to the ram, and he will be exasperated against him, and he will strike the ram and break his two horns: and there will be no power in the ram to stand before him, and he will cast him to the earth, and will tread upon him: and there was none delivering for the ram out of his hand.

8.text: And the he goat of the goats increased even greatly: and in his being strong the great horn was broken; and there will come up the vision of four underneath it to the four winds of the heavens.

9.text: And from one of them came forth one horn of a little thing, and it will be great exceedingly to the south to the sunrisings, and to the glories.

10.text: And it will be great even to the army of the heavens; and it will cast to the earth from the army, and from the stars, and it will tread them down.

11.text: And even to the chief of the army was he magnified, and from him the continuance was lifted up, and the foundation of his holy place was cast down.

12.text: And an army will be given upon the continuance by transgression, and it will cast down truth to the earth; and it did and it succeeded.

13.text: And I shall hear one holy one speaking, and one holy one will say to a certain one, speaking, How long the vision of the continuance, and the transgression laying waste, to be? and the holy place and the army being trodden down?

14.text: And he will say to me, Even to evening morning, two thousand and three hundred; and the holy place was justified.

15.text: And it will be in my seeing, I Daniel, the vision, and I shall seek its understanding, and behold, there stood before me as the sight of a man,

16.text: And I shall hear manâ€™s voice between Ulai, and he will call and say, Man of God, cause to this to understand the sight.

17.text: And he will come near my standing: and in his coming I was afraid, and I shall fall upon my face; and he will say to me, Understand, O son of man: for at the time of the end, the vision.

18.text: And in his speaking with me I lay in a deep sleep upon my face upon the earth: and he will touch upon me and will cause me to stand upon my standing.

19.text: And he will say, Behold me making known to thee what shall be in the last part of the wrath: for at the appointment, the end.

20.text: The ram which thou sawest possessing horns, the kings of Media and Persia.

21.text: And the hairy he goat, the king of Grecia: and the great horn which is between his eyes, he the first king.

22.text: And that being broken, and four will stand up underneath it, four kingdoms from the nation shall stand up, and not in his power.

23.text: And in the latter state of their kingdom as those transgressing being completed, a king strong of face and understanding enigmas, shall stand up.

24.text: And strong his power, and not in his power: and he shall destroy wonderfully, and he prospered, and did, and he destroyed the strong ones and the holy people.

25.text: And by his intelligence and he caused deceit to prosper in his hand; and he shall magnify in his heart, and in security he shall destroy many: and against the Chief of chiefs he shall stand; and without hand shall he be broken.

26.text: And the sight of the evening and the morning which was said, it is truth: and shut thou up the vision; for, for many days.

27.text: And I Daniel was, and was sick days; and I shall rise and do the works of the king; and I shall be astonished at the sight, and none understanding.
